oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Acknowledgement from the Confederate Subsistence Bureau in Richmond, Virginia, to Captain B. J. Semmes

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Armies -- Commissariat
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Major D. B. Brewer of the Confederate Subsistence Bureau in Richmond, Virginia, to Captain B. J. Semmes in Chattanooga, Tennessee, certifying that returns for the second and third quarters of 1863 have been received.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Army -- Subsistence Bureau
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Early Confederate Army regulations created the Office of Subsistence to procure subsistence stores for the army through contracts. The Commissary Department was in charge of all food or subsistence supplies at a military post.
